sentence.idiomatic: Last year in January where did you go?
Last year I studied English in England.
Last year I moved to the United States.
I moved from Nanjing Road to Beijing Road.
I want to move from China to England.
Did he move from Guangzhou to Shanghai?
Why do you prefer playing soccer?
Why do you prefer eating chicken?
Why do you like Ms. Li better?
I think that Ms. Li is really smart.
I think that Chinese food is really good.
Do you think this cell phone is good?
I am prettier than you.
Is Shanghai bigger than Beijing?
My office is better than your office.
I like Shanghai because Shanghai is very modern.
Is China modern?
Is Shanghai more modern than Guangzhou?
His home is really pretty. Do you agree?
I'm smarter than him. Do you agree? I agree.
This pork is good. I don't agree.
I rather like beef.
Shanghai or Beijing: which do you like better?
I prefer blue.
I think that Mr. Li is better.
The beef here is better.
Is my office better?
She's pretty, and she's also smart.
I like Shanghai too.
We also live in Beijing.
Last year I moved from Shanghai to Hong Kong. But I prefer Shanghai.
Why do you prefer Shanghai? I believe Hong Kong is more modern than Shanghai.
I don’t agree. I believe Shanghai is better. Shanghai is more beautiful than Hong Kong. The weather is also comparatively good.
